channel.title: Finally finished something
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/30u48e0.png[/img]
It took me 7 hours to get this done, but I did it. I know its simple but im not the greatest web devo and the most surprising thing is I didn't ask for help.. until now XD. Someone wanna make me a better looking banner? I'm the worst when it comes to photoshop.
The server mentioned isn't advertising seeing how it is in BETA and there arent ANY links and im not trying to advert my site.
*a little update*
[IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/2ltrlo1.png[/img]

item.title: Finally finished something
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

I lol’d at that areguement XD

Little update; Google is being an asshole and I am having trouble getting with their adsense program because they are stating that my information that I’m giving them references past approved accounts. When I found my old account I tried to cancel and have it transferred to my new one and they arent replying.

Read full topic

item.title: Finally finished something
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:28, topic:453945”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=556819.msg4078484#msg4078484 date=1345115707]

That will cause absolutely 0 legal issues at all.

Are you retarded? That’s stated as an opinion, not as a fact. There are plenty of companies that advertise that they are the best when they necessarily aren’t.

It was a warning to watch what he puts on his website. Not to guarantee something he can’t fulfill.

No.

You said that putting HIS company slogan on HIS company’s site is going to get HIM into legal issues?

He doesn’t need to prove anything whether he’s the best or not, he could believe that therefore no-one has a legal case against him.

Please don’t post if you don’t know what you’re talking about.
[/quote]
Not specifically his slogan. But it’s a forewarning on what he says on his website, seeing as he is new to the hosting business…[/quote]

You singled out his slogan and told him it’d give him legal issues at a later date. You say you’re trying to help him because he’s new and all you’re doing is putting retarded bullshit in his mind.

Every single company that wants to enter legally bonding issues will warn you before taking action, they will not just simply say they’re suing you and taking all of your money.

What he says on his website is HIS opinion, no website can sue him for having a slogan that attracts users and or states his opinion. The only thing that’ll do if he isn’t the #1 hosting company will get him badpress for falsifying information or whatever the fuck it is they do these days.

Read full topic

Are you retarded? That’s stated as an opinion, not as a fact. There are plenty of companies that advertise that they are the best when they necessarily aren’t.

It was a warning to watch what he puts on his website. Not to guarantee something he can’t fulfill.
[/quote]

No.

You said that putting HIS company slogan on HIS company’s site is going to get HIM into legal issues?

He doesn’t need to prove anything whether he’s the best or not, he could believe that therefore no-one has a legal case against him.

Please don’t post if you don’t know what you’re talking about.[/quote]
Not specifically his slogan. But it’s a forewarning on what he says on his website, seeing as he is new to the hosting business…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:13, topic:453945”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=556819.msg4075886#msg4075886 date=1344823483]

do remember that twitter is blocked in many countries, I absolutely despise sites that force facebook/twitter/ other social networking crap.

An easy solution to this is if jal knight was smart enough to censor the twitter widget for Chinese users. (And other countries where it is banned).
[/quote]

Fixed for you

I actually replaced the twitter shit and put in place of it announcements.

Why is it banned for some countries?[/quote]
Because they don’t want people to know about some controversial event. Tibet, Tiananmen square, Peace prize…

item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

wildskiller:

I don’t even know how to layout everything on a website. I’d get everything pushed into a corner.

That is actually a wrapper that comes with WHMCS. Once I figured out how to edit a template I threw what html I had in there and made a few changes. It’s not too difficult, but I have dreamweaver cs6 which helps a lot for me

You can’t go wrong with a plain template, you can never go wrong with a plain, light coloured template.

Almost everyone finds them appealing, and they’re user-friendly.

Best of luck with your hosting company!
[/quote]

item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:7, topic:453945”]Sounds pretty nice. Thanks for the compliment ;).
